title: args
description: The `args` object in Pure Data loads and manages the arguments of an abstraction, allowing them to be queried or changed dynamically. It outputs the current arguments through the left outlet, or a `bang` through the right outlet if no arguments are provided. Messages (float, list, or symbol) sent to `args` update the stored arguments immediately. Optional settings include a break character to split argument lists and a depth level for hierarchical abstractions. Dollar-sign placeholders like `$0`, `$1`, etc., are expanded automatically unless escaped.
